title: thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:912:9 when compiling packed_simd

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Hello,
  I found an internal compiler error when compiling [this pull request](https://github.com/image-rs/jpeg-decoder/pull/146) with rust nightly on github CI. See the CI output at https://github.com/image-rs/jpeg-decoder/pull/146/checks?check_run_id=773387154


### Meta
rustc version:   nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu installed - rustc 1.46.0-nightly (4fb54ed48 2020-06-14)

### Error output

```
error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_traits/normalize_erasing_regions.rs:37: could not fully normalize `<A as sealed::SimdArray>::Tuple`

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:912:9
```

<details>
